page.title: 07THE SELSEY LIFEBOAT PART 2
page.content: It takes 6-10 minutes to launch the Lifeboat from the first maroon.The Lifeboat is then housed and when released slides down the slipway into the sea. There are various{ways of raising {money}for the R.N.L.I at Selsey.Every year there is a{sponsored walk.}The route is Church Norton-Sidlesham-West Sands and the Bill then back to the Lifeboat Station.This year,1985 there were about 267 walkers and they had to walk 15 miles.They hope to raise Â£4400.Then there's the{Ladies Selsey {Lifeboat Association,}they do tea and coffee mornings and every Sunday morning during the summer they sell souvenirs and gifts on the seafront.
